intro: Scytalia trijuga, commonly known as the three-angled scytalia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive tri-lobed leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. Scytalia trijuga thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important plant for ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
